name: corky
content:
corky adjective
(LIKE CORK)
Add to word list
Add to word list
like cork (= the light, soft outer covering of a Mediterranean tree): These pumpkins tend to have hard, corky stems. I removed the corky skin with a vegetable peeler.
More examplesFewer examplesThe disease causes the fruits of the tree to become covered with a cracked, corky layer. The trees have a smooth bark with occasional corky ridges.The stems sometimes develop corky growths.

corky adjective
(WINE)
Wine is described as corky if its taste has been spoiled by the cork: I sent back the wine because it was corky. We drank a rather corky but nevertheless impressive claret. Synonym
corked
More examplesFewer examplesCorky wines are becoming rarer nowadays.
